private_information: I translate natural language action descriptions into a normalized, lifted STRIPS-like model with clear predicates, parameters, preconditions, and effects.
I keep symbols consistent (lowercase, underscores) and avoid inventing new predicates unless strictly necessary.
I maintain a mapping from the human names to canonical action names: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
modeler.goal: Produce a clean, consistent, lifted action library (preconditions and effects) from the public rules, suitable for compilation into PDDL by the orchestrator.

private_information: I extract scenarios, initial facts, and goals from the public information.
I normalize object symbols and ensure that facts only use declared predicates and objects.
When plans are provided, I preserve their order as a candidate reference plan without enforcing it as mandatory.
instance_curator.goal: Prepare instance bundles (objects, initial facts, goals, and optional candidate plan) for each scenario described in the public information.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency, checking for precondition satisfaction and effect propagation across candidate plans.
I flag bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any artificial constructs not grounded in the declared predicates and actions.
I recommend minimal corrections to restore consistency if needed, without changing the declared semantics of actions.
auditor.goal: Validate that each scenario and any provided plan are causally coherent with the action library and remove or flag any bookkeeping shortcuts.

private_information: I integrate the action library, curated instances, and audit results.
I compile the final domain and problem for the FastDownward planner, keeping to STRIPS-style PDDL with typing where applicable.
I ensure predicate and object naming consistency and avoid extraneous constructs.
orchestrator.goal: Produce the final PDDL domain and at least one PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver using the audited, normalized information from the other agents.

init.note: Actions are paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted; use the public_information for detailed preconditions and effects.

public_information: Actions and arguments: Paltry object_0 object_1 object_2; Sip object_0 object_1 object_2; Clip object_0 object_1 object_2; Wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3; Memory object_0 object_1 object_2; Tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2.

Action semantics: To perform paltry, required: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2. Effects true: next object_0 object_2. Effects false: vase object_0 object_1.

Action semantics: To perform sip, required: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2. Effects true: vase object_0 object_1. Effects false: next object_0 object_2.

Action semantics: To perform clip, required: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2. Effects true: vase object_0 object_1. Effects false: next object_0 object_2.

Action semantics: To perform wretched, required: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3. Effects true: next object_0 object_2. Effects false: next object_0 object_1.
Action semantics: To perform memory, required: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1. Effects true: next object_0 object_2. Effects false: next object_0 object_1.

Action semantics: To perform tightfisted, required: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1. Effects true: next object_0 object_2. Effects false: vase object_0 object_1.

Scenario 1 initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_10 object_3; collect object_11 object_3; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_12; hand object_13; next object_0 object_9; next object_1 object_9; next object_12 object_11; next object_13 object_7; next object_4 object_8; next object_5 object_11; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_9; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_10; texture object_11; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario 1 goal: next object_12 object_10; next object_13 object_9.

Scenario 1 candidate plan: clip object_12 object_5 object_11; wretched object_5 object_11 object_10 object_3; tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_10; wretched object_4 object_8 object_7 object_2; clip object_13 object_4 object_7; wretched object_4 object_7 object_6 object_2; tightfisted object_13 object_4 object_6; memory object_1 object_9 object_6; sip object_13 object_1 object_6; memory object_1 object_6 object_9; paltry object_13 object_1 object_9.

Scenario 2 initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_10 object_2; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_1; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_2; hand object_11; hand object_12; hand object_13; next object_0 object_8; next object_11 object_10; next object_12 object_6; next object_13 object_9; next object_3 object_7; next object_4 object_10; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_8; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_10; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario 2 goal: next object_11 object_8; next object_12 object_8; next object_13 object_10.

derive_actions.system_prompt: You extract a normalized lifted STRIPS-like action library from the public rules without emitting PDDL; keep names lowercase and consistent and include parameters, preconditions, add and delete effects.
derive_actions.prompt: Your name is modeler. Read the environment public information and produce a concise normalized action library for actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with parameters and their preconditions and effects. Keep only the declared predicates (hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, collect, spring). Output a compact machine-readable summary that the orchestrator can compile into PDDL later.

prepare_instances.system_prompt: You prepare clean scenario instances from public information without emitting PDDL; collect objects, initial facts, goals, and optional candidate plan per scenario.
prepare_instances.prompt: Your name is instance_curator. From the environment public information, extract Scenario 1 and Scenario 2; list objects in use, enumerate initial facts and goals, and if a candidate plan exists, preserve it as a reference sequence. Ensure only declared predicates and known objects are used. Provide a compact machine-readable bundle for each scenario.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency of each scenario and any provided plan; do not emit PDDL; remove bookkeeping shortcuts and flag inconsistencies with minimal corrective suggestions.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Using the action model and scenario instances, check that preconditions and effects line up across the candidate plan of Scenario 1 and the initial state; identify unsatisfied preconditions, missing textures, or misuse of vase relations; verify that no quota-token or post-hoc penalty constructs are present; produce a concise report with any corrections needed for solvability and a clean symbol map.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in compiling multi-scenario planning problems into PDDL for the FastDownward solver. Produce a PDDL domain and at least one PDDL problem file using only the audited predicates and actions. Keep to STRIPS-style with :typing if helpful, avoid numeric fluents or temporal constructs, and ensure all names are lowercase and consistent. Enclose the final PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The domain should define the six actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with preconditions and add/delete effects exactly matching the audited model; the problems should encode Scenario 1 and optionally Scenario 2 initial facts and goals. Target FastDownward by ensuring classical finite objects and no unsupported features.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the action model, curated instances, and audit report. Resolve any symbol normalization noted by the auditor. Then output the final PDDL domain and at least the Scenario 1 problem; include Scenario 2 as a second problem if consistent. Use only the predicates hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, collect, spring and the actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. Keep object names as given (e.g., object_0, object_1). Enclose the PDDL domain within <domain></domain> and each problem within <problem></problem>.
